title: 114_hr4093
content: The "Library of Congress Administrative Reform Act of 2015" authorizes the National Library Service for the Blind and Physically Handicapped to provide playback equipment in all formats. Additionally, the Act amends provisions related to the purchase, maintenance, and replacement of reproducers for sound-reproduction recordings. The "Library of Congress National Collection Stewardship Fund" is established in the Treasury of the United States for the Librarian of Congress. The Fund consists of transferred and appropriated amounts for the Library of Congress. The Librarian can use the Fund for specified purposes. The Library of Congress National Collection Stewardship Fund allows the Librarian to use amounts for preparing collection materials for long-term storage and transferring funds for designing, constructing, and equipping preservation facilities. The funds remain available until expended, and an annual report is required. The Librarian and the Architect of the Capitol must submit a joint annual report on the Library of Congress National Collection Stewardship Fund to the relevant committees. Additionally, within six months of the Act's enactment, the Librarian must provide a 5-year expenditure plan for the Fund to the same committees. SEC. 4. EXPANDING USES OF CERTAIN REVOLVING FUNDS. The National Audiovisual Conservation Center Fund is amended to include services related to duplication and preservation of audiovisual materials. Additionally, a revolving fund for gift shop and related services is established. The National Audiovisual Conservation Center Fund is amended to include services related to duplication and preservation of audiovisual materials. A revolving fund for gift shop and related services is established, including sales, traveling exhibitions, exhibition materials, and training. Tribal governments are now included in the FEDLINK Program. SEC. 5. AUTHORITY TO ACCEPT GIFTS AND BEQUESTS. The first paragraph of section 4 of the Act allows for a broader range of gifts to be accepted by the Library of Congress, including personal property, nonpersonal services, voluntary services, money, and bequests. In the case of a gift of securities, the Librarian shall sell the gift and provide the donor with a receipt from the proceeds of the sale. SEC. 6. CONTINUATION OF SERVICE OF RETURNING MEMBERS OF JOINT COMMITTEE ON THE LIBRARY AT BEGINNING OF CONGRESS. During the beginning of a new Congress, members of the Joint Committee on the Library who served in the previous Congress will continue to serve until the new members are appointed. The final undesignated paragraph under the heading "Senate" in the Act of March 3, 1883 is repealed. This change applies to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress and all future Congresses. The Act and its amendments will be effective starting from fiscal year 2016 and onwards.
